title: What happened to the British soldiers and officers after WW2 had ended? - Quora

response.answer_text: Like every other army, at the end of the war they were demobilised over time The vast majority had been recruited “for the duration” (of the war) The process was when it was their turn to be “demobbed” they would be sent to demobilisation depots where theywere given: A Demob Suite A Hat Pair of Shoes 2 Shirts and collars (they were separate items then) Undrerwear and socks Rail Warrant home Emergency Ration book Discharge papers And off they went

The Hostilities Only and Territorial Army soldiers were demobilised over time, and Regular soldiers carried on as per their individual signing on conditions. I think those Regular soldiers whose time expired during hostilities were some of the 1st to be demobilised.
